revised_title: Observations of Lincolnshire's Fens, Wildlife, and Resources
tldr: The author provides a detailed account of the natural resources, wildlife, and local economy of Lincolnshire's fens in the late 17th century. He describes the sheep farming, bird and fish populations, feather and quill production, oil extraction from seeds, and the fen drainage and land reclamation efforts. He also highlights the fertile pasture grounds, the town of Boston, and the famous church steeple as notable features of the region.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Wildlife Management
